com.bah.ode.server

Class WebSocketServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bah.ode.server.WebSocketServer

  • public class WebSocketServer
extends java.lang.Object
    gives the relative name for the end point. This will be accessed via ws://ip:port/ode/ws Where "ip" is the IP address of the host, "ode" is the context root and "ws" is the address to access this class from the server

    • Method Detail

      • onOpen

        public void onOpen(javax.websocket.Session session,
                   javax.websocket.EndpointConfig endpointConfig,
                   java.lang.String rtype,
                   java.lang.String dtype)
        Allows us to intercept the creation of a new session. The session class allows us to send data to the user. In the method onOpen, we'll let the user know that the handshake was successful.
        Parameters:
        session - - The WebSocket session that was just opened
        endpointConfig - - the end-point configuration object
        rtype - - the path parameter identifying the request type. Valid rtypes are:
        • sub - subscription request
        • qry - QUery request
        dtype - - the path parameter identifying the data type being requested. Valid dtype values are:
        • ints - Intersection data
        • vehs - Vehicle data
        • aggs - Aggregate data

      • onMessage

        public void onMessage(javax.websocket.Session session,
                      java.lang.String message,
                      boolean last,
                      java.lang.String rtype,
                      java.lang.String dtype)
        When a user sends a message to the server, this method will intercept the message and allow us to react to it. For now the message is read as a String.
        Parameters:
        session - - WebSocket session object
        message - - message received
        last - - true if this is the last message in a partial message transfer
        rtype - - the path parameter identifying the request type. Valid rtypes are:
        • sub - subscription request
        • qry - QUery request
        dtype - - the path parameter identifying the data type being requested. Valid dtype values are:
        • ints - Intersection data
        • vehs - Vehicle data
        • aggs - Aggregate data

      • onClose

        public void onClose(javax.websocket.Session session,
                    javax.websocket.CloseReason reason)
        The user closes the connection. Note: you can't send messages to the client from this method
        Parameters:
        session - - the session that was closed
        reason - - the reson the session was closed
